title: Writing the Problem Algebraically
text: Substitute the values for $$h$$ and $$t$$ into the projectile motion formula $$h$$ $$=$$ $$-16t^2$$ + $$vo t$$

title: Writing the Problem Algebraically
text: What is vo, the initial velocity, in $$\frac{ft}{s}$$?

title: Writing the Problem Algebraically
text: What is $$h$$, the height to reach, in ft?

title: Quadratic Formula
text: We can rewrite this equation in the format $$a t^2$$ + $$b t$$ + c $$=$$ $$0$$ to use the quadratic formula

title: Quadratic Formula
text: What is the value of a if we rewrite the problem above?

title: Quadratic Formula
text: What is the value of $$b$$ if we rewrite the problem above?

title: Quadratic Formula
text: What is the value of c if we rewrite the problem above?

title: Quadratic Formula
text: If you have an equation in the form $$a t^2$$ + $$b t$$ + c $$=$$ $$0$$, $$t$$ $$=$$ (-b~sqrt(b**2 -4ac))/(2a)

title: Quadratic Formula
text: The quadratic formula may yield two positive answers. If this is the case, choose the lower value because we want to find the time it takes to initially reach $$260$$ ft
